title: Binary Tree Postorder Traversal
description:
Binary Tree Postorder Traversal

Leetcode 145. Binary Tree Postorder Traversal

You are given the `root` of a binary tree, return the **postorder traversal** of its nodes' values.

Examples:

  • Input: root = []

    Output: []

Constraints:

  • `0 <= number of nodes in the tree <= 100`
  • `-100 <= Node.val <= 100`
solution_text:
Binary Tree Postorder Traversal

Algorithm:

  1. Traverse left subtree recursively
  2. Traverse right subtree recursively
  3. Process current node (add to result)

Time Complexity: O(n) - visit each node once

Space Complexity: O(h) - recursion stack depth, where h is tree height

Key Insights:

  • Postorder: Left -> Right -> Root
  • Node is processed after both subtrees
  • Useful for deleting trees or calculating node depths
verify:
def verify(actual_output, expected_output):
    passed = actual_output == expected_output
    output_str = str(actual_output)
    return [passed, output_str]
